It should be noted that using CMIP5 model simulations, the geographical distribution of the CMIP5 model ensemble mean response in the total precipitation for doubling and tripling of CO 2 concentrations
11 is quite similar to that due to QCO 2 (Fig. 2a–c). This result indicates that the spatial structures of tropical rainfall change are not much influenced by the magnitude of atmospheric CO 2 concentration change, implying that a similar mechanism may work for the doubling, tripling, and quadrupling of CO 2 concentrations in a warmer world. However, it is noted that the degree of inter-model agreement is higher for the QCO 2 experiment.
